conclusion: Identify the objects: Object A is a white block, Object B is a brown block, Objects C, D, E, and F are the surfaces on which the blocks will be placed.
Understand the movement: Objects A and B are moved through the air and placed down at the locations of objects C, D, E, and F respectively.

Effect of gravity: When an object is placed on a surface, it will exert pressure on that surface due to its weight. Gravity pulls the objects downward, causing them to make contact with the surfaces directly below them.
Object A will come into contact with object C.
Object B will come into contact with object F.

Since the blocks are moved through the air and placed directly on the surfaces, there is no additional force or movement between the blocks and the surfaces other than the gravitational pull. The blocks will simply rest on the surfaces where they are placed.
Final answer: Object A will come into contact with object C. Object B will come into contact with object F.
